intro: Zephyranthes saltensis, commonly known as the salt marsh bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer or early fall, producing white or pale pink flowers that are often fragrant. It thrives in wet, saline soils and is often found in marshes and tidal flats. Zephyranthes saltensis is adapted to brackish environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
